**Title:** Advance Procurement Notice: New Office Buildings 19 Wing Comox, British Columbia (With Security Requirements)

**Reference Number:** PW-23-01029109

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-04-17T17:00:00

**Introduction**
This Advance Procurement Notice serves as a preliminary notice for the potential procurement of consultant services for the design of two new office buildings at 19 Wing Comox, British Columbia, with anticipated security requirements.

**Purpose of the Contract**
The purpose of this contract is to acquire consultant expertise in multi-disciplinary architectural and engineering services for the design of the new office buildings. The design scope will include, but not be limited to, architectural, structural, mechanical, electrical, and civil services. The buildings will be designed according to the Government of Canada's 2020 Workplace Standards, supporting a flexible office workspace.

**Security Requirements**
To be eligible for contract award, consultants must hold a valid and active Designated Organization Screening (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Defence Construction Canada (DCC) offers sponsorship for consultants to apply for the required security clearance through its Industrial Security Program (ISP).

**Process for Sponsorship**
Interested consultants are advised to begin the security clearance application process by submitting a sponsorship request application to DCC through its website at https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry/security-requirements. DCC will review and forward the sponsorship request package to the PSP, PWGSC on behalf of the consultant.

**RFP Information**
* RFP Number: KN79518
* Estimated Contract Value: $750,000
* Contract Award: Conditional on approval by the Department of National Defence (DND)
* Anticipated Contract Start Date: March 2023

**Contact Information**
For questions regarding the sponsorship process, please contact ISP.Sponsorship@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or (613) 998-8974. For questions regarding this Advance Procurement Notice, please contact Mark Harvey, Coordinator, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada at Mark.harvey@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or (250) 465-8346. 

Note: This Advance Procurement Notice is not a bid solicitation, but rather an opportunity for interested consultants to initiate the sponsorship process for a potential security clearance. The Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is not responsible for any delays or issues
